text: General elections were held in Thailand on 22 April 1979. The result was a victory for the Social Action Party, which won 82 of the 301 seats. Voter turnout was 43.9%.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p285 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Social Action Party||4,179,174||21.1||82||+37 |- |align=left|Democrat Party||2,865,248||14.6||33||–81 |- |align=left|Thai Nation Party||2,213,299||11.3||38||–18 |- |align=left|Seritham Party||979,398||5.0||20||New |- |align=left|People's Nation Party||759,302||3.9||13||New |- |align=left|New Force Party||544,733||2.8||8||+5 |- |align=left|Thai Citizen Party||528,210||2.7||32||New |- |align=left|Democratic Action||274,591||1.4||3||New |- |align=left|Social Agrarian Party||239,122||1.2||3||–6 |- |align=left|Social Democratic Party||162,240||0.8||0||New |- |align=left|United Thai Party||119,046||0.6||0||New |- |align=left|Siam Reform Party||106,916||0.5||0||New |- |align=left|Supporting Kriangsak's Policy||94,425||0.5||0||New |- |align=left|Other parties||397,533||2.0||6||– |- |align=left|Independents||6,197,082||31.5||63||New |- |align=left|Total||19,660,319||100||301||+22 |- |colspan=5| |- |align=left|Valid votes||8,937,074||95.6||colspan=4 rowspan=4| |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||406,971||4.4 |- |align=left|Total||9,344,045||100 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||21,284,790||43.9 |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Thailand Category:1979 in Thailand Category:Elections in Thailand Category:April 1979 events in Asia
title: 1979 Thai general election
